intro: Museniopsis submontana, commonly known as the mountain museniopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Museniopsis submontana is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
